Supply Chain Planning Analyst I, Finished Goods (2-2-3 schedule 6PM-6AM)

The Supply Chain Planning Analyst I Is responsible for creating and executing strategic production and planning strategies to support customer demand. The candidate for this position must be a self-starter, capable of developing and achieving the strategy objectives in a fast paced environment and be able to successfully interface with all levels of internal management. This position works closely with Manufacturing, Operations, Purchasing, Sales, Transportation and Customer Service to create and maintain a production schedule that ensures customer delivery and quality requirements are achieved.

Essential Functions

  • Produce production plans, maintain system planning parameters, including recommending process improvements while prioritizing to meet customer orders.
  • Ability to understand inventory policy and execute a high level of adherence to the policy.
  • Monitor and adjust forecasts to meet changing customer needs and ensure MRP drives accurate raw material requirements.
  • Revise production schedule daily according to customer orders, established priorities, and manufacturing constraints.
  • Serve as an effective liaison among other functional departments within the organization.
  • Work with cross-functional partners to continuously improve forecast accuracy, demand planning efficiency, transportation routes and loading, and customer service.
  • Continuously analyze inventory position with customer service, purchasing, and operations.
  • Utilize system reports as well as experience and judgment to meet production and sales requirements.

Competencies

This position embodies the values of Niagara’s LIFE competency model, focusing on the following key drivers of success:

  • Lead Like an Owner
    • Makes safety the number one priority
    • Keeps alert for safety issues and escalates immediately
    • Effectively prioritizes tasks based on department goals
    • Shows respect to others and confronts interpersonal issues directly
    • Prioritizes resolution of customer issues effectively
    • Responds promptly and honors commitments to internal and external customers
  • InnovACT
    • Makes recommendations to continuously improve policies, methods, procedures, and/or products
    • Demonstrates adaptability by reacting appropriately to unexpected changes in situations or circumstances
    • Increases performance through greater efficiency
  • Find a Way
    • Seeks to develop technical knowledge through learning from other experts
    • Understands interdepartmental impact of individual decisions and actions
    • Seeks solutions rather than placing blame
  • Empowered to be Great
    • Consistently looks for ways to improve one’s self through growth and development opportunities
    • Communicates clearly and promptly up, down, and across
    • Communicates effectively to manage expectations
Education

  • Minimum Required:
    • Bachelor's Degree in Business, Data Analytics, Supply Chain or other related field

  • Preferred:
    • Bachelor's Degree in Business, Data Analytics, Supply Chain or other related field
Certification/License

  • Required: N/A
  • Preferred: N/A

Foreign Language

  • Preferred: None Required
